page.title: 01CHRISTLETON & WAVERTON 1985
page.content: Our survey area contains much of the old ecclesiastical parishes of Christleton and Waverton mentioned in the Domesday Book together with the village of Rowton.It retains a rural character despite the recent growth of new housing estates.The land is intensively farmed and there are market gardens providing fresh produce for nearby Chester.The villages are linked by a stretch of the Shropshire Union Canal,the A41 Road and the Chester-London Railway. Nearness to Chester with its sources of employment and good communication with the rest of Britain make the villages popular places to live.This is helped by having good schools and recreational facilities.About 7000 people live here,in houses of red brick and sandstone,many with attractive gardens lining the banks of the canal.
